scenarioDescription:
The 14 And Exoplanetary System


Overview

14 And is a star with 2.2 times the mass of the Sun, and 11 times its radius. It is located 246.05 light years away from the solar system.

14 And is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the 14 And system


14 And b

14 And b was discovered by the Okayama Astrophysical Observatory observatory, in 2008-12, using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 0.83 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of 14 And b is 1526.400 times the mass of Earth. The radius of 14 And b is 12.900 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, 14 And b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system 14 And, which contains 1 exoplanets and was discovered by the Okayama Astrophysical Observatory.
name: 14 And - System With 1 Exoplanet
